creditline: Collection of Yvonne and Gabriel P. Weisberg
description: cat. 22; man leaning against a small log and wire fence; horses and sparse buildings in background; brown paper; white mat; simple, medium stained wood frame
medium: Brush and black ink, black chalk, and pastel on tan paper
text: Jules Adler was a prolific painter of social-realist themes who was moved by the scenes of poverty and destitution he witnessed in the streets of Paris and the surrounding countryside. Wandering Tramp in a Field drew public attention to the presence of the indigent in the countryside. Beggars were visible not only in large cities but also, to a lesser extent, in rural areas, where they helped on farms or relied on the kindness of villagers and farmers to subsist.
title: Wandering Tramp in a Field
